definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: The only thing these interests he is cash.
sentences.chinese: 一个使他感兴趣的事件根本那是多挣钱。

sentences.english: But many girls end up dropping out to help with the family or earn money doing odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 但是很多女孩还是辍学在家干活，或者去打零工挣钱。

sentences.english: The boys are trying to devise some scheme of earning money.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在设法构想挣钱的妙策。

sentences.english: so I can start getting paid to take people climbing.
sentences.chinese: 所以我可以带人攀岩挣钱了。

sentences.english: Her father pays for her rent and board but Lucy keeps herself in clothes.
sentences.chinese: 露西的父亲负担她的吃住，她自己则挣钱添置衣服。

sentences.english: Also, for down times when there are no alliance ops whatsoever just use your alts for making some cash.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，当没有会战的时候，用你的小号挣钱。

sentences.english: When he was 15, and was working in a Church as an assistance organist, Ludwig was practically supporting the family.
sentences.chinese: 贝多芬15岁时就在教堂担任助理风琴师，挣钱养家。

sentences.english: Can't you earn enough to keep from taking coal off the coal cars?
sentences.chinese: 你难道挣钱不够，非到煤车上去偷煤不可吗？

sentences.english: Sure. Have you heard about NET. com? Most of the company's profits come from games.
sentences.chinese: 当然了。你知道网易吗？网易全靠它的游戏挣钱呢。

sentences.english: Realized the parents make money is not easy, thus swears off the bad habit of randomly spends.
sentences.chinese: 体会父母挣钱不易，从而戒掉乱花钱的坏习惯。

sentences.english: Frost is not after "easy gold" but rather hard-earned wages.
sentences.chinese: 弗罗斯特不追寻这些轻易得来的金钱而是实在地挣钱。

sentences.english: And they, too, are thought to have superhuman powers when it comes to making money.
sentences.chinese: 当谈到挣钱时，他们也被当做是拥有超能力的异类。

sentences.english: He did this with a group that performed flying tricks to earn money.
sentences.chinese: 他和一群人一起表演飞行跳伞，以此来挣钱。

sentences.english: But Ratti Bai, why did you come to Bombay to earn money?
sentences.chinese: 可是，拉蒂巴姨，为什么是你来孟买挣钱呢？

sentences.english: Are you interested in making a long-term investment or in turning a quick buck ?
sentences.chinese: 你对长期投资有兴趣还是短期挣钱快的？

sentences.english: Nowadays, in many American families, both the husband and wife are breadwinners.
sentences.chinese: 如今，在美国许多家庭中，夫妇双方都挣钱养家。

definition: to support a family/to raise a family
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
